intro: Pomaderris subcapitata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pomaderris, is a shrub native to southeastern Australia. It features small, elliptical leaves that are typically covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers during the spring and summer months. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to arid conditions. Pomaderris subcapitata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in native garden landscapes.
